授業目的:
This two-year Seminar, running in both virtual and real environments, using both quantitative and qualitative methodologies for comparative studies, explores critical issues on urban governance, policy on urban (contrasting the rural) development and the urban reality (in and out of the media) of some key metropolitan cities.  Graduation Thesis is integral part of learning outcome. 
Students learn different analysis-methods to understand urban policies and problems.
到達目標:
Students learn urban analysis methods and develop their critical analytical power to make good decision or commentary on urban development issues.
Students can write a good graduation thesis with good critical review on policy (reports) now and for the future.
関連科目:
Other Courses taught by the Teacher ( O.K.LAI )
CHECK the LUNA for more References, and 教材フォルダ (Teaching References Folders):
 plus Learning Material Folder: y 三田 OK_LAI_SPS_2023-24_References
授業の概要・背景:
This Class is FACE-to-FACE Teaching; plus Learning Folder at LUNA
Graduation Thesis will be assessed only completed before the School's Deadline.
Students are expected to do research work beyond class-teaching - references.
授業方法:
Lecture by Teacher, Presentation by Students, Small Group Discussions & Debate  Please Check with LUNA E-Mail from Prof.O-K.LAI 2 Reading Weeks - up to 4 classes (for Book & Project Review, with no Lecture)
2 Fieldwork Exercise (to be done by Students) and Reading Weeks when no classes conducted. When the Course is E-Learning "ON DEMAND" Please check with the E-Learning at LUNA

第33回:
Literature review in the 1st year, individual/group field works will be conducted in some key, accessible cities (to be confirmed) in later stage.
Students will be trained to work with various fieldwork and policy analysis skills in both real and virtual environments.
Graduation Thesis must be submit 1-week before the Deadline, making sure final assessment for graduation.
Reading month: (April-May) for students with one-two meetings; lectures, seminars and discussions (May-July) on the important issues of urban/regional development in Asian and European context.

This two-year Seminar, running in both virtual and real environments, using both quantitative and qualitative methodologies for comparative studies, explores critical issues on urban governance, policy on urban (contrasting the rural) development and the urban reality (in and out of the media) of some key metropolitan cities.
Students learn different analysis-methods to understand urban policies and problems.
トピック.授業計画1:
Literature review in the 1st year, individual/group field works will be conducted in some key, accessible cities (to be confirmed) in later stage.
Students will be trained to work with various fieldwork and policy analysis skills in both real and virtual environments.
Graduation Thesis must be submit 1-week before the Deadline, making sure final assessment for graduation.
Reading month: (April-May) for students with one-two meetings; lectures, seminars and discussions (May-July) on the important issues of urban/regional development in Asian and European context.
トピック.授業外学習2:
Ready to learn - use multi-media communications; Reading Weeks for Individual e-Learning, plus Fieldwork. ON DEMAND E-Learning at LUNA
This Class is FACE-to-FACE Teaching but Might be ON DEMAND Learning. 
 Daily International News Reading, Study and Review. Mini-Fieldwork might be conducted.
Students are expected to read-study at least 3 readings, to watch-study 2-videos and daily reading of international news, for every lecture-week.
